page.title: 06THE BECK
page.content: STAINSBY BECK. In the northern segment, one of the main natural features is Stainsby Beck,which flows north before joining Blue Bell Beck at the end of West Plantation Wood. West of the beck is farmland belonging to Stainsby Hall Farm.Two crops currently in evidence are barley and wheat. Land to the east leading to the beck is designated green belt. This is land which by law is only for leisure activities. It is extensively used by children and adults of the area. Children use it for games and adults for walking and exercising their dogs. Alongside the beck are the following trees:elder, hawthorne, willow, rose and alder.Growing wild include:nettles sourdock,blackberry,thistles,clovers and buttercups.
